alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 3:58AM CDT until May 15 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Grimes, Montgomery and Walker. * WHEN...Until 630 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 357 AM CDT, Emergency management reported closed roadways in Montgomery County due to flooding from earlier heavy rainfall in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The following roadways have been reported as not passable in Montgomery County: FM 149 at Jackson Road, Johnson Road between FM 1097 and FM 1486, Bailey Road, and West FM 1097. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pinehurst, Magnolia, Montgomery, Bedias, Dacus, Richards and Dobbin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
